abstract: Luxpro, fresh from a legal victory against Apple Computer over whether its portable music players are ripoffs of Apple’s iPod Shuffle, is seeking $100 million in damages in the case.
lead_paragraph: Luxpro, fresh from a legal victory against Apple Computer over whether its portable music players are ripoffs of Apple’s iPod Shuffle, is seeking $100 million in damages in the case.

headline.main: Taiwan Firm Sues Apple in Shuffle Skirmish

abstract: John Sculley, the former C.E.O. of Apple Computer, may have gotten the boot from Steve Jobs, but hey, no hard feelings.
snippet: John Sculley, the former C.E.O. of Apple Computer, may have gotten the boot from Steve Jobs, but hey, no hard feelings.
lead_paragraph: John Sculley, the former CEO of Apple Computer from 1983 to 1993, may have gotten the boot from Steve Jobs, but hey, no hard feelings. Mr. Sculley had nothing but praise for the company and his former colleague.
